pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:0.4: The sub-chapter on the dark of the night
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:0.5: 14. The training rule on dismissing a companion
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā stood and talked alone with men on streets, in cul-de-sacs, and at intersections, and she whispered in their ears and dismissed her companion nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.3: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.4: “How can Venerable Thullanandā do such things?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.5: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā does this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.8: “How can the nun Thullanandā do such things?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.10: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:1.11.1: ‘If a nun stands or talks alone with a man on a street or in a cul-de-sac or at an intersection, or she whispers in his ear or dismisses her companion nun, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.6: a carriage road is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.8: one departs the same way one enters.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.10: a crossroads is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.12: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of standing together and talking.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.16: just the man and the nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.18: if she stands within arm’s reach of the man, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.20: if she stands talking within arm’s reach of the man, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.22: if she speaks into the ear of a man, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.24: if, wanting to misbehave, she dismisses her companion nun, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.25: If the companion nun is in the process of going beyond the range of sight or the range of hearing, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.1.26: When the companion nun has gone beyond, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.1: If she stands or talks outside of arm’s reach, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.2: If she stands or talks with a male spirit, a male ghost, a _paṇḍaka_, or a male animal in human form, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.4: if she has a companion who understands;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.5: if she is not seeking privacy;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.6: if she stands or talks thinking of something else;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.7: if she does not want to misbehave;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.8: if she dismisses her companion nun when there is something to be done;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.10: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc14:2.2.11: The fourth training rule is finished.
